thread.title: Sun strike may be factor in Whangamoa crash
thread.title_full: Sun strike may be factor in Whangamoa crash

author: Jessica Long
title: Sun strike may be factor in Whangamoa crash
text:
Sun strike may be factor in Whangamoa crash JESSICA LONG Last updated 11:26, February 6 2017 Charles Anderson 
The crumpled vehicle after it collided with a truck on the Whangamoas on Waitangi Day. 
A man was injured after a small four wheel drive vehicle hit the rear of a truck and trailer unit believed to have been affected by sun strike, near the Whangamoa Hill summit. 
The crash happened on State Highway 6 between Blenheim and Nelson, on the Rai Valley side of Collins Valley, about 7.45am on Monday. 
The four-wheel drive with a single occupant collided with the back of a truck. NELSON MARLBOROUGH RESCUE HELICO 
The accident scene on State Highway 6 which was blocked after the collision. 
The Nelson Marlborough Rescue Helicopter, which flew the man to Nelson Hospital, said in a statement that the truck was believed to have slowed or stopped due to sun-strike. 
The man was removed from his vehicle by fire rescue crews and was treated at the scene by St John Ambulance paramedics. 
He was taken to Nelson Hospital's emergency department with multiple trauma injuries. 
The trailer unit was also damaged in the collision. 
The highway was currently closed and police expected it to be shut for several hours. Police at the scene have advised motorists to avoid the area where possible.
